head.title: The Favorites Win Their Opening Heats

hedline.hl1: The Favorites Win Their Opening Heats

abstract.p: Intercollegiate Rowing Association national championships begin on Cooper River in Cherry Hill, NJ (S)

block.p: Cal-Berkeley's undefeated men's heavyweight varsity crew, favored to defend its Intercollegiate Rowing Association national title on the Cooper River in Cherry Hill, N.J., tomorrow, won its opening heat yesterday to advance to today's semifinals.

Cal, the Pacific-10 Conference champion, was a winner in 5 minutes 42 seconds. Brown, which won the Eastern Sprint Championship two weeks ago, captured its opening heat in 5:43.7. Washington also won its heat, as did Wisconsin, which posted the fastest time of the day at 5:41.0.

Cal-Berkeley's undefeated men's heavyweight varsity crew, favored to defend its Intercollegiate Rowing Association national title on the Cooper River in Cherry Hill, N.J., tomorrow, won its opening heat yesterday to advance to today's semifinals.

Cal, the Pacific-10 Conference champion, was a winner in 5 minutes 42 seconds. Brown, which won the Eastern Sprint Championship two weeks ago, captured its opening heat in 5:43.7. Washington also won its heat, as did Wisconsin, which posted the fastest time of the day at 5:41.0.
Semifinals in all the men's heavyweight events will be rowed today. Tomorrow, heats and finals for the men's and women's lightweight events and heavyweight men's finals will be decided.
